item.title: Some Useful Lemmas
item.description: Completeness 1.1 $-\sup -A = \inf A$ Let $\alpha = \sup -A$. Then, by definition, $\alpha \ge -a, \forall a \in A$. Therefore, $-\alpha \le a, \forall a \in A$. Hence, $-\alpha$ is a lower bound of $A$. Hence, $-\alpha = - \sup -A \le \inf A$. Let $\beta = \inf A$. Then, by definition, $\beta \le a, \forall a \in A$.
